review_title: Application was rather quick and painless.
job_title: TRIAGE COORDINATOR in Gulf Breeze, FL
pros: The HR department was quick to any questions.
cons: I have no cons to address

review_title: Low pay, no retirement matching, no overtime atm
pros: Health insurance and prescription plan allows free generics and brand name meds with such low copays Pto accrual is great Coworkers/teamwork
cons: Company is trying to save money before new hospital is opened, eliminating lots of positions and departments and demoting them barely puts a dent into the saving goal. This was done poorly in the middle of the day. 403b/401k matching has been paused again, twice since covid began, not that it was high at 2.25% to begin with. Low pay... but it's supposed to be acceptable because we are a non-profit organization. No raises after they gave a majority of the organization a raise in 2022 to match market, so there are some who have not received a raise since 2021. No parking garages at new hospital. New hospital is like a mile away from a competing hospital that has parking garages. Only 20% discount for employees at cafeteria, other hospital gives 30% off for their employees. Barely any advancement opportunities since positions/departments are being eliminated Staff shortages due to people leaving to work for other hospitals and overtime is not allowed atm

review_title: Excutive Silo Culture- employees are replaceable
pros: great co workers are the main pro
cons: stopped 403b/401k contributions in 2020 for all employees while top executives receive 6 figure bonuses. This year 2023 May, same wage freeze (seems they are always on a wage freeze except for new hires) and again stopped contributions to employee 403b/401k! This company is gettimg too top heavy with well staffed administration, well paid admin, with significant wages, and, bonuses. They continue to want more out of staff however never offer Staff any incentives, raises, genuine feedback. Same old script all the time with to changes. poorly run hospital with greedy top admin. The people make this hospital great NOT admim seems to be suckimg the life out of potential profits. keep handing out pizza coupons to your hard work employees, dropping your very small 403b/401k contributions, and continue to think an insincere thank you video really helps your connection with the "Team". Get real!! Maybe work on some of your large executive expenses, 6 figure bonuses, and yearly increasing excutive pay increases rather than be so quick to take from your staff.

pros: Great people. Support from management.
cons: Pay is not in line with industry average. Benefits are not the best. Recent layoffs have lowered moral.

pros: None! There is not anything Pro about this place. They are only worried about money and do not pay or take care of their employees whatsoever. No COLA or raises and major cuts without notice...
cons: Everything and anything you can think of. Double standards, ethics, HA-they dont know the meaning of that word here. They are liars and back stabbing evil people. Management is sneaky and underhanded. AVOID THIS PLACE!!!!!

pros: I love the people I work with
cons: Baptist has a 403b freeze and I have not had a pay raise in 3 years almost

job_title: Cardiovascular ICU Registered Nurse in Pensacola, FL
pros: Overall, the company treats its employees well and focuses on the patients. There are always some rotten eggs, but if you find the right manager, you will love your job. The hospital also utilizes self-scheduling for nurses, which usually means a varied schedule but you get to pick your hours. Again, if you have a good manager, this means good coverage for all shifts and you get the shifts you want, or at least don't work on the days you requested off.
cons: Certain units have insecure, power-hungry people in leadership roles, such as charge nurse. It really brings down those units and contributes to turnover rates.

pros: Good health insurance; retirement plan
cons: Culture has changed; management more interested in profits than people. Low salaries

review_title: Top Heavy - just want warm bodies to show up to work
pros: Great people to work with but they are all leaving one by one
cons: This used to be a great place to work but management has become far removed from the bedside. They’ll let us drown without offering to help at the bedside, pick up phones, answer call lights, anything to help, or even show up. Our director was overheard saying that we are all replaceable. They are hiring without providing adequate training and orientation to the ICU. All input from staff is dismissed as negativity without addressing what our needs are. Patients are suffering due to lack of training, education, staff and resources. It is slowly crumbling mostly due to the negligence of management and lack of advocacy for our field. There is no regard for best practice, no high reliability, no progressive attitudes, no empowerment among staff. We’re exhausted and spread thin. Many are looking for jobs elsewhere.

pros: The benefits are really good.
cons: Outdated computer systems that do not sync with other programs. No written protocols for some areas regarding safety. Departments do not work together well for the overall benefit of the patient.

review_title: Great company mission, but low pay for the amount of work
pros: Most leaders within Baptist have a positive attitude and truly want you to succeed in your role. The benefits through Baptist were very competitive.
cons: There are some positions within Baptist in some offices that require more than one person to do the job, but some employees are not offered the help. The employees that work hard and diligently, are overloaded with tasks. And the ones that do just enough to get by are usually the ones that supervisors will not bat an eye when they make a mistake.

pros:
During my almost 6 years at Baptist I have been privileged to work with some of the smartest, most caring and compassionate nurse, techs, physicians and ancillary staff that I have ever encountered in my 16 years as a nurse. 

Willing to take into account your family needs when scheduling. 

Reasonable benefits with added savings for participating in Healthy Lives. 

Approachable manager that is always willing to hear concerns and help facilitate change to better benefit staff and patients. 

Competitive pay

Excellent communication from my manager about any changes that may be coming, including weekly communications via email with all details of the prior week and monthly staff meetings that is an open forum for suggestions and concerns. 

Positive feed back for a job well done. 

No forced overtime but it is available if you want it. 

Opportunities for personal and professional development. 

Constantly looking to bring in new physicians of all specialties and new and improved technology to help us provide the best care to our patients. 

Recent turnover in leadership is bringing many positive changes and accountability that wasn't there before. 

Increase in the focus of recruiting and retaining highly qualified staff for all areas. 

Progressive renovations to update the hospital. 

Recent purchase of new state of the art medical equipment for all of the patient care areas. 

I am very proud to be a Baptist Employee. I am very encouraged by recent changes and the focus that is now being placed on the staff and providing the necessary tools to provide our patients the best care.
cons:
FMLA benefit is inadequate. 

Not in the best area but the hospital provides security officers 24/7 on site as well as local law enforcement on site at night time. 

Tuition assistance/ reimbursement is low

While we do have good insurance, our copays can be expensive for ER and specialties. 

High prices in the cafeteria despite the discount.

pros: Great coworkers across the organization. Fairly good benafits.
cons: Lower than average pay.  No room for growth within department.   Management found it easier to train new people for new openings than training existing employees for a new position and someone esle to replace them.  Not enough explainiations as to why things are done the way they are done.  Forget giving feedback on ways to improve the dept.  It will not be acknowledged as a good idea, but miraculously a short time later will be implemented as a great idea of management.

pros:
Care about every employee as an individual.
Fast growing--currently building a brand new facility.
They offer a lot of ways to get involved with the community, because they are a community based hospital.
I could honestly go on for hours bragging about how great this place is. If you are considering working here (Especially as an RN), I would HIGHLY recommend you chose here over other hospitals in the area. Baptist truly has a unique culture that is unmatched.
cons: The current hospital is a little old, but the new one will be done in 2023....so i guess there really isn't a con.

review_title: Definitely the B hospital in Pensacola
job_title: Psychiatric Registered Nurse in Pensacola, FL
pros: Most of the floor staff are great to work with.
cons: High turn over rate of both nurses and support staff,   Middle management bullies run free.  Frivolous write ups Example;  Will write up staff for carrying their cellphone even if they have special family circumstances.  Employee relations has no power to enforce hospital policy and will always side with the company even for blatant violations.  Provides Press Ganey surveys to  patients while still in the hospital and only to patients who have not complained during their stay to avoid low survey scores.  Baptist Hospital of Pensacola gives other Baptist Hospitals such as the ones in South Florida a bad name.

review_title: Working here pays the bills............but just barely
pros:
They work with your schedule and try to accomodate your needs.
Their Patient Satisfaction scores are close to the best in the nation.
cons:
Horrible Benefits when compared to other local hospitals
Below average pay for the amount of work that you do.
Location is downtown in a bad neighborhood.

pros: Baptist Healthcare has great employees.  They are passionate about their jobs and taking care of their patients.
cons: Local hospital which limits resources.  Minimal investment in tuition reimbursement (may or may not receive).  HR department is poorly managed and staff are rude.  Benefits cut consistently year over year and changes are poorly communicated to staff.  People are not appreciated.  Minimal opportunity for development.

review_title: Overall, a very nice place to work, with many very kind people working there.
pros: Atmosphere is pleasant with a prevalent attitude emphasizing the importance of team work and family. Fulfillment each and every time you make a patient laugh or feel more comfortable.
cons: Salary is not very competitive.
